capturedMetadata.responseText:
I'm Hermes' project assistant. I can help you with status newsletters, Azure DevOps hierarchy validation, SLA violation tracking, and discovering user PR activity.

Summary
- Source: WorkItem SLA check for visomasu@microsoft.com (tool result). Key findings: 264 SLA violations across your team; you are a manager with 11 direct reports. (Tool: CheckSlaViolations)
- Immediate risk: multiple long-open bugs/tasks that have exceeded SLA by months (some >400 days). These are actionable escalations that need triage now.

Top urgent violations (samples)
| Work Item | Type | Days since update | SLA threshold | Link |
|-----------|------|-------------------:|---------------:|------|
| 4528211 | Bug | 400 | 2 | https://dev.azure.com/dynamicscrm/OneCRM/_workitems/edit/4528211 |
| 4439974 | Bug | 428 | 2 | https://dev.azure.com/dynamicscrm/OneCRM/_workitems/edit/4439974 |
| 4390140 | Bug | 438 | 2 | https://dev.azure.com/dynamicscrm/OneCRM/_workitems/edit/4390140 |
| 4400845 | Task | 480 | 5 | https://dev.azure.com/dynamicscrm/OneCRM/_workitems/edit/4400845 |
| 4400787 | Task | 480 | 5 | https://dev.azure.com/dynamicscrm/OneCRM/_workitems/edit/4400787 |
| 2877867 | Task | 1,262 | 5 | https://dev.azure.com/dynamicscrm/OneCRM/_workitems/edit/2877867 |

Recommended next steps
1. Triage workshop (30–45 min): review the items above and assign owners or close-as-obsolete. Start with Bugs #4528211, #4439974, #4390140 due to low SLA thresholds and long staleness.
2. Quick wins: identify and close stale tasks (e.g., #2877867) or convert to backlog items with updated owner/dates.
3. Prevent recurrence: enable automated SLA notifications for the owning teams (I can register you—see capability: "Register for SLA notifications").

Assumptions & data gaps
- The SLA report includes DaysSinceUpdate and SLA thresholds but does not include severity, current assignee, or business impact fields — I inferred urgency from DaysSinceUpdate vs threshold.
- This is an aggregated team-level export; if you want a per-direct-report breakdown or a paginated full list, I can produce that on request.

Do you want:
- A full paginated export of your 264 violations, or
- I register you for daily SLA notifications, or
- I create a prioritized triage list of top 20 items with owners and suggested actions?

(Examples cited above: work items #4528211, #4439974, #4390140 — source: SLA check tool output.)

capturedMetadata.responseText:
I can run an SLA check — but tool access is limited to the current signed-in user for this session. The system is configured to use visomasu@microsoft.com as the Teams user ID for SLA tool calls, so I cannot directly run a check for user@microsoft.com from here.

Options:
1. Run the SLA check now for the current user (visomasu@microsoft.com). Reply "Run for me" and I'll fetch the violations.  
2. If you need a check for user@microsoft.com, either:
   - Ask that user to request the check while signed in, or
   - Confirm you have authorization and provide the target user's Teams user ID and any required consent, and I will attempt the lookup (may be blocked by permissions).

Assumptions & data gap:
- Assumes tool policy requires the session user (visomasu@microsoft.com); I cannot impersonate or query other users without their session or explicit authorization.

capturedMetadata.responseText:
Summary (quick)
- SLA check found 264 violations across your team; you are listed as a manager with 11 direct reports. Source: SLA run for visomasu@microsoft.com.
- Immediate observation: you have many long-overdue items — several tasks and features exceed SLA by hundreds of days. Top overdue items are shown below.

Top overdue items (highest DaysSinceUpdate)
| Work Item | Title (short) | Type | Days since update | SLA threshold | Overdue by | Link |
|-----------:|---------------|------|------------------:|--------------:|-----------:|------|
| 2877867 | Make the onebranch builds as required for telephony service | Task | 1262 | 5 | 1257 | https://dev.azure.com/dynamicscrm/OneCRM/_workitems/edit/2877867 |
| 3014575 | [CommonInfra Nuget Update][SecurityCompliance] Uptake latest common Infra nuget | Task | 1103 | 5 | 1098 | https://dev.azure.com/dynamicscrm/OneCRM/_workitems/edit/3014575 |
| 3127199 | [Doc][Voice] Teams residency DFD - Transfer and consult doc update | Task | 1044 | 5 | 1039 | https://dev.azure.com/dynamicscrm/OneCRM/_workitems/edit/3127199 |
| 3367044 | Evaluate if the AddParticipantsWorkflowV2 if required in case of Warm Transfer complete | Task | 1001 | 5 | 996 | https://dev.azure.com/dynamicscrm/OneCRM/_workitems/edit/3367044 |
| 3516801 | [OCMon Dashboard] V29 Initialize call for voice channel | Task | 916 | 5 | 911 | https://dev.azure.com/dynamicscrm/OneCRM/_workitems/edit/3516801 |
| 3516798 | [OCMon Dashboard] V09 Agent can place an outbound call to a customer | Task | 856 | 5 | 851 | https://dev.azure.com/dynamicscrm/OneCRM/_workitems/edit/3516798 |

Urgent production/quality risks to review
- Bug 4528211 — "Agent Monitor seeing 99.46% reliability..." (Bug, DaysSinceUpdate 400, SLA 2). High-risk operational impact; recommend urgent triage (see #4528211).
- Bugs and production-impact items appear in the list (e.g., #4439974, #4390140). These should be prioritized above long-running documentation/tasks if they affect customers.

Recommended immediate actions
1. Triage meeting: run a 30–60 minute triage for the top 10 overdue items (start with the oldest production-impact bugs). Suggested owners: current assignees or rotate to on-call SRE/product leads.
2. Quick fixes: for items that are stale but low effort (documentation, small tasks) — close or reassign within 48 hours to reduce noise.
3. Escalation: escalate critical bugs (e.g., #4528211, #4439974, #4390140) to product/SRE with target remediation dates.
4. Hygiene: set or confirm ownership and update the work item comment/status to reset SLA tracking where appropriate.
5. Automation: I can register you for daily SLA notifications or create a curated filter/dashboard showing only items overdue >30 days or production bugs — tell me which and I’ll set it up.

Assumptions & data gaps
- Data source: WorkItem SLA check for visomasu@microsoft.com (tool output). I used DaysSinceUpdate and SlaThresholdDays to rank urgency. Example IDs: #2877867, #3014575, #3127199, #3367044, #3516801, #3516798, #4528211.
- Missing from the SLA output: assigned owner, priority/business impact, and current iteration — I inferred urgency solely from SLA breach duration.
- Some long-standing items may be intentionally inactive (backlog/epics kept open). Recommend confirming business priority before reprioritizing or closing.

Next step options (pick one)
- I can create a prioritized list of the top 25 items with current assignees and suggested owners for a triage session.  
- I can register you for daily SLA violation emails for your team (automated).  
- I can generate a short escalation note for the top production-impact bugs to send to the SRE/product leads.

Which would you like me to do?
